fields.description:
If you want to apply a patch you should be able to do this by a URL also.
eg. if you have a PR from github I dont want to download the patch file first but apply it right away.

Would be great if that could be done. 

(eg. check if that "file" starts with a protocol different from file:// and download that to a tmp dir and remove it afterwards)
fields.summary: git: Apply patch from URL

fields.description:
I added a repository with Sourcetree.
Sourcetree created a repo on the users directory.
Stop SourceTree
Deleted the new folder it on from console, (rm Users/./folder) 
Then opened SourceTree removed it from userinterface. 
Then opened the same project from an earlier existing git location on disk.
Then Push
Crash in Submodule Check Dialog on open ...

2014-11-24T10:47:21: Stack trace: 
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.SubmoduleCheckDialogViewModel._OpenSubmodulePushDialog(SubmoduleActionEntry entry) in c:\Users\Kieran\Documents\Development\sourcetreewin\ViewModel\SubmoduleCheckDialogViewModel.cs:line 347

fields.summary: sourcetree crash

fields.description:
I recently upgrade my version of SourceTree to v1.6.11.0.

The upgrade appeared to run through fine.

Now, when I attempt to start SourceTree, it crashed and gives me the 'oops' pop-up message.

Please find the log file attached.
fields.summary: Application Crash on startup after upgrade to v1.6.11.0

fields.description:
I have a LOT of repositories active in my bookmarks view - more than fit into a single screen and I jump back and forth between a number of them on a regular basis. I also have a lot of tabs with repos open.

Neither one of those lets me easily find my most recently worked on repos so I have to go digging either through tabs or the bookmark list to find what I need.

It'd be really nice if the Bookmark list would sort by most recently used repo at the top or at least provide an option to select an order (currently it looks like there's no real order there).
fields.summary: Show Bookmarks list in last used date order

fields.description: I'd been trying to push my TortoiseHG changes to GitHub with no success ("invalid argument" error) so I thought I'd try SourceTree to push.  The Progress bar turned brown and even though it said "look above for errors" none were reported.  I finally clicked "Close" and the system crashed.
fields.summary: Pushing to GitHub

fields.description: When opening a big repo (several gigs) in source tree, the display hangs forever. Opening the same repo in gitk and even jumping their from commit to commit is not a problem. With this performance issue we can't use source tree. On the command line git status, git log or other commands are fast enough.
fields.summary: Source Tree slow on big repositories

fields.description: I have a lot of repo's and bookmarks. As a user i want to be able to quickly find the bookmark. A search function would be nice.
fields.summary: Search for a bookmark

fields.description: If you have a lot of repository's and for every repo a bookmark, you can get lost. It would be nice if you can sort the bookmarks alphabetical. This way you can quicker find a repo and also check if a bookmark is missing, but repo is on file system.
fields.summary: Sort the book marks

fields.description: If there are any changed files, that were also moved to another location inside of a project - SourceTree can show differences for them, but for unknown reason "External diff" context menu item is disable for them.
fields.summary: External diff cannot be run on moved files

fields.description:
I am using Source Tree for Windows 1.6.11 and 1.6.10

My Source Tree crashes when i make these steps:
1- at any branch i rebase interactively from any commit
2 - At the rebase window, i pick a commit and press the Edit Message Button.
3 - I write the new message or even press cancel button
4 - SourceTree crashes and Windows 7 launch the message that SourceTree stopped working.

Uninstalled source tree and deleted project and made all over again.
The problem remained.

The problem doenst happen in version 1.6.8
fields.summary: Win SourceTree crashes at Edit commit message in rebase interactively

fields.description:
Whatever push brach of option's git tab  may set up, it does not save from "matching". 
Although I choose "current" from a push branch setup and "O.K." is pushed, in re-showing or git push, it works as "matching".
fields.summary: not save push brach setting

fields.description:
Getting error "Error writing to file C:\Program Files(x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\7za.exe". 

I was running 1.6.5 which I tried to upgrade. Got the error while upgrading the source tree. Then I tried manually installing the 1.6.11 but got the same error. 

Now even 1.6.5 is not getting installed on my Windows 7 laptop. Just to confirm if there is some stale connection I rebooted few times but even that didn't helped. Also I installed HipChat to ensure Windows Installer is not the culprit.
fields.summary: Error installing SourceTree 1.6.11

fields.description: Scroll mouse inside view of unstaged files and the application hangs.
fields.summary: Hanging when you are scrolling mouse inside Staged/Unstaged files view.

fields.description:
When you click the menu bar's Commit button with files highlighted (not necessarily checked), the staging mode gets kicked back to "no staging".

Steps to reproduce:

1. Have Fluid Staging or Split View Staging enabled.
2. In the Working Copy screen, have some files already staged.
3. Highlight some files. (see screenshot #1)
4. Click Commit in the toolbar.

Actual result: The mode is changed to "No staging" before the commit message window appears. (see screenshot #2)
Expected result: The commit message window appears with no change to the staging mode.

I can see how this might have been meant as a feature, but I think the software shouldn't do this because this bites me all the time. My workflow goes like this:

1. Make some changes.
2. Highlight the files I want to stage and press spacebar to stage them. (the files remain highlighted).
3. Click commit. I'm now kicked out of staging mode.
fields.summary: Commit button disables staging when files are highlighted

fields.description:
I select commit in Graph (it is not the last commit) and press Home button to go to the top.
The same crash happens if I select any other commit (other than selected initially on startup) by mouse.
fields.summary: Crush when selecting commit in commit tree

Hi,
I found the following bug please resolve for better UI.
In footer there is sign up form but due to iframe height the sign up form does not showing properly, the current height is 52px and this should be more than 102px;

prntscr.com/57w8xj

Regards
fields.summary: Website footer newsletter issue

fields.description:
Hi,
I found the following bug please resolve for better UI.
In footer there is sign up form but due to iframe height the sign up form does not showing properly, the current height is 52px and this should be more than 102px;

prntscr.com/57w8xj

Regards

SourceTree crashed

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a file "#testfile.txt" in the repo
# Access SourceTree "File Status" tab
# Right click on the file "#testfile.txt" and select the option "Ignore..."
The filename "#testfile.txt" is added to the file ".gitignore" instead of the following line:
{noformat}
\#testfile.txt
{noformat}

The hash character should be escaped when adding it into the ".gitignore" file
fields.summary: Hash character is not escaped when ignoring the file

fields.description:
We are using stash with an internal server.
My team depends on this so I need help asap.
Thanks,
Jim Donelson
fields.summary: Hangs in windows 7 - GUI goes unresponsive when you do just about anything.

fields.description:
We have git repositories where the first commit (initial import) contains thousands of files.
With Sourcetree on Windows, selecting that commit virtually hangs the application (for minutes).
Same thing for another commit than the first one if it changes a lot of files.
Until version 1.6.8, this problem didn't exist, it appeared from 1.6.9 and is still present in 1.6.11, as I discovered by trying successive versions.
OSX versions do not have the problem either.
fields.summary: Performance issue on commit with many changed files

fields.description:
I have just upgrade SourceTree to latest version 1.6.11, because it asked to for auto update. After installation, I'm no longer able to work with SourceTree.

The application will run and load all information about repositories, but will display error, that it has encountered a bug and points me to a log file.
fields.summary: Cannot work with SourceTree after upgrading to 1.6.11

fields.description: Switching between branches temporarily freezes the UI and sometimes crashes sourcetree.
fields.summary: Switching between branches freezes the UI and sometimes crashes sourcetree

fields.description:
Switching between tabs in the latest version frequently crashes on Windows 7.

The customer is unable to run source tree for more than 10 or 15 minutes at a time.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes Frequently

fields.description: When I push to server, if there is an error, SourceTree tends to crash.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on push when server returns any error

fields.description: See log
fields.summary: Continuous crash if set tree view

fields.description:
i did one commit for a branch and then went into repository --> Interactive rebase option. As there was only 1 commit, i clicked on the edit message option after selecting the commit.

as i did that it crashed.
fields.summary: problem with Interactive rebase...

fields.description: When trying to create a Patch when pushing the Create Patch button a MessageBox comes up saying Please select at least one file. I have several files already staged. This used to work fine
fields.summary: Create Patch no longer works

fields.description:
sourcetree.log is attached (it's the last error, you may find some other issues to fix in the previous logs so I kept them)

The repro steps are easy in our case :
1. Have some local uncommitted changes
2. Try to pull from server (there has to be some changes to pull)
3. Click on Close button when the error message is displayed (failed to pull because of uncommitted changes)

The rebase after pull option may have been selected here.

Our repo makes use of subrepositories.

The issue appeared with 1.6.9 and is still occurring with 1.6.11.
fields.summary: Crash after a failed pull due to uncommitted local changes (Mercurial)
Error when selecting files to commit

fields.description: When we first setup the account, projects would appear under our "browse hosted projects" world icon button when checking out a new repo in Sourcetree. We first noticed it a few months ago, but since then we have been unable to browse any repo using the Sourcetree client.
fields.summary: Unable to see Hosted Projects under company's Bitbucket account

fields.description: I have a file with several changes, when staging a hunk, the diff view will go completely blank. To bring it back, I have to select a different file and then re-select the one I was staging before.
fields.summary: Staging Hunk results in empty diff view

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a folder 'FolderA' with 3500 new files
# Switch to "File Status" tab
# Set the view to be "Tree View"
# Expand 'FolderA' to view all the files -> SourceTree hang
# Restart SourceTree
# Switch to "Flat List" single/multi column - no problem
# Commit all 3500 files in the repo
# Switch to "Log/History" tab
It will select the first commit automatically. Trying to load 3500 files at the bottom will cause SourceTree hang too

*workaround*:

The issue is with performance in the treeview, to avoid this flat view's should be used in preference to the treeview. 
There are currently two possible work arounds.

*Workaround 1: Reset the User preference, in v1.6.9 to 1.6.11, to use a flat view*

# Shutdown SourceTree
# Find the <Version>/user.config file in a folder below %localappdata%/Atlassian/SourceTree where <version> is 1.6.9, 1.6.10 or 1.6.11
# Edit the user.config and set FileStatusViewMode to 0, i.e:
{code}
            <setting name="FileStatusViewMode" serializeAs="String">
                <value>0</value>
            </setting>
{code}
# Restart SourceTree

*Workaround 2: Revert to 1.6.8*
A workaround is by uninstalling the current version and install SourceTree version 1.6.8:

- https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/SourceTreeSetup_1.6.8.exe
fields.summary: Too many files will cause SourceTree to hang

fields.description:
When any dialog/messagebox appears, the spacebar should "press" the focused button. Currently it doesn't.

This is normal Windows behaviour, so this must have been disabled for some reason. No need for that.

Attached is an example. When such dialog appears, the space key should press the Close button, as does enter.
fields.summary: Space to select active button doesn't work

fields.description:
When I go and create a patch (for uncommitted work, not sure if this matters) the button "Create Path" in the create patch window that appears, always yields the message "Please select at least one file".

In my particular case, one file *is* selected. See attached screenshot. In it, app.js is staged *and* selected, clearly.

It makes no difference whether the selected file is staged or unstaged.
fields.summary: Create patch doesn't work

fields.description:
After performing an update via the build in update notifications the pinned icon on the taskbar no longer displays.

This has happened for the last few versions.
fields.summary: After performing update pinned icon disappears

fields.description:
I have 2 staged files, I go to Actions -> Create Patch. I press the "Create Patch" button and I see the "Please select at least one file" message box. If I stage / unstage all files the dialog closes. I tried selecting files with CTRL, staging, unstaging them, nothing works.

The destination file does not exist, it shouldn't exist as it has to be created by SRCTREE however it's on a path that SRCTREE has access to (root of the repository).
fields.summary: Cannot create a bug "Please select at least one file"

fields.description:
When you switch to another repository, it immediately reads from the remote, which causes a delay. This makes it difficult to quickly switch between repository tabs.

A delay should be added in contacting the remote so that repository switching is faster.
fields.summary: Improved Speed In Switching Repositories

fields.description:
There is a bug on SourceTree instalation when use subst utility for drive mapping.

Step To Reproduce:
1. Map new drive A with windows application subst  to any folder
2. Try to Install/Upgrade SourceTree 

ScreenShot http://prntscr.com/577u9h
fields.summary: Instalation bug, when use subst utility

fields.description:
I've created a git-repo on bitbucket, cloned it on my PC using SourceTree.
I've been using SVN with some projects and moved them into git-repo root folder using windows explorer. After that I've focused on SourceTree window, it freezed during refresh (async file updating would be great!) and crashed with the error window which sent me here.
fields.summary: Crash after refresh.

fields.description:
Added New Repo in Bitbucket
Created Repo in SourceTree + Bitbucket connection
First commit to new repo with immediate upload to BB gave an error, local seemed to have commited, but no connection to BB was made (no password question either)
Tried to do it again, then Sourcetree crash, now i can't open it at all, immediately error and crash window
fields.summary: Can't start SourceTree anymore

fields.description:
After updating to 1.6.10, the "Stage hunk" button - the most important button and by far the biggest reason I got hooked on SourceTree - is gone. So is the "Stage lines" that used to appear after I select some lines. Rolled back to 1.6.8 and they're back.

Since this wasn't in the release notes, I'm hoping that this is a bug and not an intentional change.
fields.summary: "Stage hunk" button is gone

fields.description: After adding a Bitbucket repo to SourceTree, it sometimes decides to start bugging me about Pageant. What makes this a major issue is that it just won't stop. If it starts, it will continue doing this every 3 seconds, forever.
fields.summary: Incessant "Your SSH agent (Pageant) is running" notifications

fields.description: After downloading the latest version, I see everything takes about 20 times longer to refresh than it did before. Doing anything causes this. I looked at the process and it was maxing out one core. Looks more like it is doing some sort or internal re-indexing that I/O.
fields.summary: Downloading 1.6.10.0 performance degraded to 5% of what it was before

fields.description: Please add an option (and I recommend it be enabled by default) to use the Windows Recycle Bin when deleting files.  I ran into an issue today where I was cleaning up a repo and had to remove a large number of files.  I also accidentally deleted a few files I didn't mean to.  While this is clearly my error, I've also grown accustom to having the Recycle Bin to back up file deletion.  This seems like fairly typical functionality in Windows applications (and the Trash Can on Macs).
fields.summary: Use Recycle Bin when deleting files

fields.description: After upgrading to the most current version, I was unable to see the lines of code changed in a .sql file.  One of my repos is purely SQL scripts with an XML settings file.  The XML file is still showing the lines changed.
fields.summary: .sql Files Not Showing Lines Changed

fields.description: This feature would add all git repos under a current folder, for example a Projects folder.
fields.summary: Feature: Add all   git repos in folder.

fields.description:
*Steps*:
# Add some files to the stage
# Select <Create Patch> from Actions menu
# Enter patch filename and location
# Click <Create Patch> button

*Expected*: A patch file is created containing the diff for all staged files
*Result*: Keeps on asking to select at least one file

fields.description: SourceTree said a new version was available. I updated. Now it crashes when I try to open it.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes immediately upon open

fields.description: SIngle child, trying to change a comment
fields.summary: NullReferenceException in "Rebase children interactively"

fields.description: when I finish hotfix (with git flow) i check option: 'Tag with this message' but it does not work, please see attachment
fields.summary: git flow tag problem

fields.description:
The 'Sign off' commit option (--signoff) should be remembered (either on a global or a on a per-repository basis). Currently the option is forgotten on a restart of SourceTree.

Also, it will be good to have indicators near Commit button to indicate the status of the chosen 'Commit options'. I'm especially interested in knowing with one look whether the 'Sign off' option is enabled or disabled. But it will also be nice to have indicators for options like 'Amend last commit'. Currently I have to remember to pull down the 'Commit options' drop-down menu to see what options are enabled or disabled.
fields.summary: Remember last sign-off setting, indicate setting status near Commit button

fields.description:
Using the new tree view, under "Pending, sort by status":
with split staging view some of the pending (tracked) files from other sub-paths get bumped way down the list. Screenshot attached.
If I go to "no staging" view, then all pending changes to tracked files remain at the top of the list. This is how I expected it to remain sorted even under the split staging mode.
fields.summary: Split staging view with tree view gives odd sort by status
Fatal error:  System.NullReferenceException
chekc in bug

fields.description:
I get the following error trying to remove/discard a file with the Danish letter 'Ø' in the filename. Commit worked fine, but deletion/discarding and removal fails.
Unknown if it affects other danish letters: æ,ø,å, Æ,Å in other cases.
------
hg remove -y -f "Private_Stuff\Nicolai's �konomi.mny"
Private_Stuff\Nicolai's ?konomi.mny: The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect

Completed with errors, see above.
------

fields.description:
Everytime when I switch the tab from Log/History to File Status with some unstaged files SourceTree crashes. I have Treeview, Split view staging and Panding files, sorted by file status selected.

Sourcetree version 1.6.10.0

Steps to reproduce it:
Start SourceTree
A repo with no unstaged files is shown
Switch to a repository with unstaged files
The repo will be shown with active Log/History tab
Click on File Status tab
Crash
fields.summary: Crash on switching the tab from Log/History to File Status

fields.description: As summary says, clicked Actions->Apply patch, chose a .diff from TortoiseSVN in the file browser. Boom.
fields.summary: Opened patch file from TortoiseSVN to apply

fields.description:
By default, the tree in the staging area has all nodes collapsed and there is no easy option to expand all nodes.
Either the nodes should be expanded by default, or there should be an easy way to collapse/expand all nodes.
fields.summary: Automatically expand tree view

fields.description: I have a project that has submodules. In a multi-programmer environment, whenever I pull the project, the submodules are in danger of being switched to HEAD, rather than staying on the branch I want them to be on. This is okay. But the mistake I keep making, because it is far too easy to make in SourceTree, is to make a change in sub module code and then commit, without noticing that the sub module is on HEAD, not the branch I thought it was on. The feature request I am making is to add a preference to SourceTree that will allow me to tell SourceTree to warn me if I am about to commit to HEAD. After all there is a warning popup for when leaving HEAD, so why not a warning popup for committing to HEAD? Can you think of a good reason why you might want to commit to a HEAD and create a detached branch in the process? I can't! There is no end of people asking how to undo a commit to head on the internet, so obviously I am not the only person falling into this hole. Thank you!
fields.summary: Committing to a sub-module HEAD is too easy.

fields.description: I clone my repository from my server and work with it on the next start of sourcetree, sourcetree crashed.
fields.summary: System.IO.PathTooLongException: Der angegebene Pfad und/oder Dateiname ist zu lang. Der vollstÃ¤ndig qualifizierte Dateiname muss kÃ¼rzer als 260 Zeichen und der Pfadname kÃ¼rzer als 248 Zeichen sein.

fields.description: When trying to edit a commit message while doing an interactive rebase, ST crashes without issuing any error message. It even crashes when canceling the editing. This never happened with 1.6.8.
fields.summary: Crash when doing an interactive rebase

fields.description:
At first, source tree appeared to be unable to detect changes in my code base. After several attempt to modify the code with no success.

Then I launch Git in terminal to manually commit (with no success to make source tree work properly detecting changes) and remove this specific code file from repo, commit and re-add, which seems to cause source tree crash at the Log/History pane.

fields.description:
After merging a branch, where there are merge conflicts, selecting both Resolve Conflicts using 'Theirs' and Resolve Conflicts using 'Mine' both result in the using 'Theirs'.

Even the prompt that asks "Are you sure" for both cases actually says "Theirs" even though I selected "Mine"
fields.summary: Resolve Merge Conflict using 'Mine' doesn't work

fields.description:
In a repository, if you have untracked files which can be added, and if you choose to use tree view disposition, you cannot add multiple files by selecting them and drag them to the staged files zone

It works with non-tree view disposition
fields.summary: Unable to add multiple untracked files at once in tree-view
Got an exception while working on a commit

fields.description:
2 things - firstly this page's UI is saying 1.6.10 is unreleased, but I got 1.6.10 via the automatic update of Sourcetree this morning.

Secondly, the Stage and Unstage hunk buttons are missing completely. The Reverse hunk button is present for previous commits, but nothing when staging.

Pretty important.
fields.summary: Lost Stage hunk and Unstage hunk buttons whilst staging.

fields.description: Log file attached
fields.summary: Crash when collapsing Tags tree

fields.description: Without these buttons its really difficult to do a selective stage and commit, that was one think I used to really like about Source Tree
fields.summary: "stage hunk" and "stage lines" buttons missing in the live diff display

fields.description:
When viewing the list of hunks for a revision, or that are currently changed (E.g., in the bottom right window for the Log/History tab), the hunks are aligned vertically, and there is a vertical scrollbar along the right to scroll through them.  If one of the hunks has many (contiguous) lines that have changed, and some (of the top lines) are long (horizontally), then a scrollbar will appear to see the full line - but the scrollbar is placed at the bottom of the hunk, which may not be visible when viewing the top lines.  One has to scroll down to the bottom of the hunk, move the horizontal scrollbar to the right, and then scroll back up.  It would be better to put the horizontal scrollbar at the bottom of the window (i.e., at the same level where the vertical scrollbar is), rather than at the bottom of each hunk.

There is a work-around, which is to scroll horizontally using the keyboard arrow keys.
fields.summary: Hard to scroll horizontally due to scrollbar placement

fields.description:
Previously in other versions of SourceTree I would double click on a file to open it in the associated program.  After updating to 1.6.10 double clicking does not perform anything.  

You can still open the file by right clicking, but I miss this functionality.
fields.summary: Double click on File in File Status View no longer opens file

fields.description:
Don't ever try this at home. 
I had many files in many directories. When I tried opening parent directory in explorer, SourceTree opened ~50 Explorer windows. I thought it will display only the selected one. Attachment is included.
fields.summary: Show in Explorer option in Tree view opens thousands new windows

fields.description: Files delete confirmation box height is too big when a lot of files are selected so it goes out of screen boundaries
fields.summary: Files delete confirmation box height is bigger than screen height

fields.description:
After upgrade to 1.6.10 tonight, every operation has significant lag.
Clicking on different changeset has 2-5 second+ lags.  Didn't occur on previous version.
fields.summary: 1.6.10 - serious performance issues for repos small and large

fields.description:
Provide some way of differentiating between the repos based on their host/account e.g.
* github repo owned by user
* github repo watch by user
* github repo owned by organisation user is part of.
* etc
 
 in the Remote repos views and/or in the Bookmarks view.
fields.summary: We need some differentiation between my personal repos, my starred repos and my organisational repos. They are all together now.

fields.description:
The `Stage Hunk` and `Discard Hunk` buttons dont show up for me.

I'm on Windows 7, 64bit and just updated from 1.6.8 to 1.6.10.

*Work Around*

* In the Diff panel. click on the cog/gear menu
* Select *Show Whitespace*
fields.summary: "Stage Hunk" and "Discard Hunk" buttons gone

fields.description:
If you start an interactive rebase, choose Edit Message of a commit, actually edit it and try to save the message, SourceTree crashes.
Found it out while trying to check if SRCTREEWIN-1725 is still present.
Tried it several times, found no dependance on commit message language, commit number or anything else, the bug seems to be constant.
Not sure if it affects 1.6.9 because I skipped that update.
Log attached.
fields.summary: Crash on interactive rebase - edit commit message

fields.description:
Kieran Senior asked me to file an issue based on an answer I had posted on AAC:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/143622/answers/10402883

The gist is that commit.template works in command line git, but not on Sourcetree
fields.summary: commit.template is not honored in Sourcetree

fields.description:
Since version 1.6.9, commit button is disabled (grayed out) even if some files are selected and there is a commit message.

It was an update from v1.6.8 with the auto updater.

Uninstalling and re installing v1.6.8 fixed this problem.
fields.summary: Commit button is disabled

fields.description:
If I mark a file and scroll down press shift and click on the last file to select all the files are selected.
But nothing happends if I click on the select column. Drag and drop works but I think a user would expect that if you click on one of the ceckmarks in the left column all the selected files should be moved up to the staging area
fields.summary: MultiSelect files to be added to a commit

fields.description:
There is a scheduled refresh of remote "default" branches, so you can see that your branch is falling behind and pull it.

However, it doesn't appear that it can do this for other branches. Maybe it would be too much overhead to do this automatically of every local branch of every local repository that is tracking a remote branch.

But how about it automatically refreshing the remote tracked branch for the currently checked out local branch, if it is not the default? There are many times where this is likely to be the case, if someone is using Git Flow, or similar best practice for separating development.
fields.summary: Remote refresh for branches

fields.summary: Crash while fetching remotes in Git

fields.description: Add ability to create Hg bookmark
fields.summary: Support Hg bookmark creation

fields.description:
SourceTree is a great tool for managing git sandbox.  
A small enhancement that would simplify viewing diffs is the abillity to ignore whitespace.  Frequently I enclose a section of code in a block (if, loop, or for HTML <div>).  This causes a whole section of code to be indented. Your Internal Diff View shows many lines changed, although only the first and the last line in the section are the real changes.  I already use an external diff tool to verify that only whitespace has changed, but this takes a little extra time when reviewing changes.
fields.summary: Add "Ignore Whitespace" option to Diff

fields.description: While switching from various tabs or clicking buttons when the new file tree view is enabled, SourceTree 1.6.9 beta 3 sometimes crashes. Attached is the log showing a NullReferenceException.
fields.summary: NullReferenceException with MultiSelectTreeView

fields.description:
It would be great if you can add the text links to the branch names so I can click an the Branch to open for example the jira story of it.

In our porjekts we use feature Branches so our Branches are named like the Jira Stories.
fields.summary: Text Link in Branch Name

fields.description:
I was a working on a very big (>2GB) Git repo.
The log seems to have all data about another Hg repo I have in my system.

I was in the commit window from this Git repo about selecting which files shoudl be commited.
fields.summary: Crash

fields.description: While sliding the splitter bar between the file window and the preview window, when the filenames are long a scrollbar appears on the bottom but, it disappears when you let the slider go. It also shows the right side of the filenames instead of the left side. An example has been attached.
fields.summary: Scrollbar disappearing

fields.description: See screenshot: in the *reverse hunk* pane, the file path is not rendered properly, whereas it appears properly in Log / History pane, as "Vélocité/Déposer ici.txt". Looks like an UTF-8 issue.
fields.summary: File name with e-acute and other multi-byte characters not displayed properly

fields.description: After using the terminal to stage the changes from several hunks, (including using manual hunks) the graphical interface shows the changes on the file reaming in the "Unstaged files" section, but it doesn't detect the change in the "Stagef files" section and will not show the staged file until the user clicks on a branch under the "Branches" and clicks back on the "Working Copy" or restarts Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Staged changes not shown

fields.description: When SourceTree is running on a machine, and a user uses VNC to connect remotely to that machine, the menus do not show up. This includes the menus along the top (File, Edit, etc) as well as right-click menus. The UI appears to recognize the mouse click that should have shown a menu, but nothing appears. SourceTree works fine on the same machine when used locally.
fields.summary: Menus do not appear over VNC

fields.description: I started a histedit session from the command line and minimized it. I forgot about it and returned to SourceTree. SourceTree stopped updating the File Status view. I could not see uncommited changes. When I pressed Commit, it crashed. I started SourceTree again and it still wasn't working. After I canceled the histedit it began to work again.
fields.summary: File Status not working + Crash on commmit while ongoing histedit
Closing Remote list

fields.description:
Fast-forward in checkout is quite useful, when you are moving for instance another branch to current commit. 

Benefits:
- with huge number of changes, the operation is still fast (you need not to do two checkouts: one back to the other branch and one caused by after fast-forward)
 - without this feature, in case you have opened an IDE (for example Visual Studio), it may rebuild intellisense two times -- which could be slow more complex projects

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10395574/
fields.summary: Support for fast-forward another branch without check out

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a lot of repository under my repository view, I take time to search the right repository. Could it be possible to add a search field under the repository view panel ?

Thank you

Regards
fields.summary: Add repository searching under repo view

fields.description:
As a deveoper in Windows. I like to use WondowsPowerShell(or PS). And I always use PS with posh-git as the terminal in git. I like GUI, I like SourceTree, but sometimes I need CLI to work well. Now I can only use the default bash with git or the Command Prompt with Windows when I press the Terminal button in SourceTree. 
Is there one way for me to use PS within SourceTree or could you give me a choice in setting in the next version?
fields.summary: Can I use WindowsPowerShell when I press the Terminal button on the tool bar?

fields.description:
SourceTree does not open the external diff tool if the internal diff is disabled (by setting the maximum filecount to 0) or when the internal diff does not display changes (e.g. when the line endings have changed from windows to unix style).
This is very unfortunate as it limits diffing of files, where the internal tool is insufficient. External diff should be available for all files in the modified pane, no matter what the result of the internal diff is.
fields.summary: External Diff not started if internal diff is turned off or detected no changes

fields.description:
When a remote shares two URLs, SourceTree currently handles the situation poorly and prompts for authentication using the username of the first remote (it's hardcoded/unchangable in the dialog prompt).

This is exasperated by the fact that I can't go into the settings and add a default username nor remembered password; so I'm stuck in a situation where I can't authenticate against the second URL, but I can't make SourceTree aware of the credentials either.

For reference on why I have this dual-URL setup: I have an academic project that I have to host through GitHub, but our team wants it in Stash too. GitHub is our primary URL, and we added Stash as the secondary. This prevents us from having to push/fetch from two origins; Git is configured with the single GitHub remote fetch URL and the dual remote push URL.
fields.summary: Add support for one remote with multiple URLs

fields.description:
I clicked create branch in the Stash web UI; the create branch dialog opened in the SourceTree UI.  When I clicked in the dialog to create the branch, the UI crashed.

I did have the Options dialog box open in SourceTree when I started this.

Crashlog attached.
fields.summary: Crash when trying to create a branch with options dialog open
